Explanations.a: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm.
Explanations.c: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding of patients, personnel, and outcome assessors.
Explanations.d: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect. Small sample size.
